intro: Mayepea luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon mayepea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. The leaves are ovate and hairy, with a distinctive scent when crushed.
